line_2: And the glaze of its half-closed eye

line_1: Hath made a bliss of agony:
line_2: Who mourns his maiden's broken tie,

line_1: Clings to her knight in speechless agony:
line_2: And bids the mariners each effort try

line_1: It threw my Soul into an Agony.
line_2: When told you went to intercede for me,
But oh repentant may we be,

line_1: And prompts the throb of agony.
The strings of nature crack'd with agony!
line_2: Nor sought in vain! at that heart-piercing cry

line_1: And hush the groan of life's last agony!
line_2: Thy darling form shall seem to hover nigh

line_1: She waits her doom in silent agony;
line_2: She hears once more with breathless ecstasy,
Yon martial plume that waves on high,
